title: Why is it important to track Flash CD?
body:
Anyone? I don't get it. I just assume it's always up.

Also. What is the exact CD on Flash..? Like isn't everyone's different? How do we know the exact time if they have Masteries for lower CD?

replies.body:
1: 
 If you know its down. You can use your own {{summoner:4}} to kill them. Or, you can take it in or out of consideration of what may happen in a fight. 

Lets say I'm {{champion:55}}  vs {{champion:99}} . Normally, If I flash to jump onto her, She will just snare, flash, E, ult. I'm dead.

If she has no flash, then she will take all my damage, because she can't get away. She needs to decide whether to try to juke my damage or out damage me. 

 I need to {{summoner:4}} onto her because she's too far away. She isn't just gonna let me jump onto her in a favorable position where I do not need to flash. 



2:
Normally it is 300 seconds. If they have {{item:3158}} or the mastery. You can hover over their summoner spell and see the cooldown.

>You can hover over their summoner spell and see the cooldown.

Wait, what? I thought that was only for 'pinged' allied summoner spells.

You can't see the current cooldown, but it will tell you what the cooldown of it is with their setup.  
like 300 seconds
or 270 seconds. 

Do you see what i mean? its doesn't track the current cooldown of it counting down, but it tells you basically the max cooldown with their setup
Oh...that's...actually pretty damn useful! Thanks for telling me about it!
I actually didnt even know about it until like a month ago! lmao

Hover vs Click. 

Hover will tell you the max cooldown of a spell for that player, clicking will just put it in chat (and if you're playing with timestamps on your chat and you ping it when it happens, you can know when it's up again), including the time remaining for allies.

it's 300 seconds
minus 15% reduction from tank masteries
minus 10% reduction from Ionian boots

You can do a quick math in games

Counting flash gets more important towards late game
when the stake is not just a kill but a whole teamfight
Why do the math in game? Just mouse over it in the Tab menu and it'll tell you the cooldown duration for that player's Summoner Spell.

I would disagree with counting it being more important late game.  In a team fight it doesn't generally matter who has flash and who doesn't.  I think the most important thing about knowing flash cooldowns is for junglers to gank.  If a jungler ganks a lane that doesn't have flash, the chances of securing a kill are drastically raised from when they did have flash.  This will allow the jungler to snowball lanes easier.

It also makes decision making a little different for the laners if the enemy has flash or not.  You might be low health and safely be able to farm from a distance if the enemy doesn't have flash but pretty much be guaranteed to give them a kill if they do have flash.
Just mouse over their Summoner Spell in the Tab menu, no need to guess it's max cooldown or look it up on a website.

if you hover your enemies summoner spells you can see their cooldowns on it. So if they have the insight mastery you can tell just by hovering it. They have to expose themselves first, so you cant check in the first 1:30 of game when you likely wont see them.

You can also change your settings to show chat times and keep track of CDs that are pinged which you should ping if you see any Sums go off including yours to show your team what you have to work w/ atm.

1.  Yes, it's worth while.  Why wouldn't it be?

2.  Idk the exact cd cus im a scrub that doesnt track it, but you can tell simply by looking at their Keystone.  If they have the bottom keystone in the right tree, they likely have SUmmoner CDR.  ALmost 100%
That tells you who is likely to have it but you will also miss a lot of people who put 12 points into resolve.  I usually look up masteries during the loading screen with http://www.lolnexus.com/

It's really helpful for junglers. If Mid flash is down, the jungler can slam down a Control Ward, pitch a tent, lean back in a lawn chair, and just have a grand ol' time for the next four-to-five minutes!

If you know it is on cooldown, you know they cant flashbear you, or escape over a wall..

Pretty self-explanatory shit.

Flash has a 5 minute CD. It is important for the laners to put the time of the flash coming up again after being used into the chat so the rest of the team and more specifically the jungler can know. It is also important to know if flash is up or not while deciding whether to turret, go for risky plays, etc.
